definition: to surrender and pay allegiance to

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: if no one comes to rescue us, we will surrender to you.
sentences.chinese: 若沒有人救我們，我們就出來歸順你。

sentences.english: This success enabled him to claim the allegiance of central burma.
sentences.chinese: 這一勝利使他得以要求緬甸中部歸順於他。

sentences.english: If lords and princes could obey him, all things would abide by him.
sentences.chinese: 王侯若能持守他，萬物會自動歸順。

sentences.english: He will bring many of Israel's people back to the Lord their God.
sentences.chinese: 他要勸導許多以色列人回心轉意，歸順他們的上帝。

definition: to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to go on a punitive expedition
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
